Primitive type

　There are some primitive types defined in tjsTypes.h.

tjs_int
Signed integer (minimum 32 bits)
tjs_uint
Unsigned integer (minimum 32 bits)
tjs_int8
8-bit signed integer
tjs_uint8
8-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int16
16-bit signed integer
tjs_uint16
16bit unsigned integer
tjs_int32
32-bit signed integer
tjs_uint32
32-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int64
64-bit signed integer
tjs_uint64
64-bit unsigned integer
tjs_char
Wide character (used as a primitive type of TJS2 string type)
tjs_nchar
Narrow character
tjs_real
Real type (double)
tTVInteger
same as tjs_int64
tTVReal
same as tjs_real

tTJSString

　The tTJSString type is a string type used in TJS2, and handles tjs_char type zero-terminated character strings. Defined in tjsString.cpp / tjsString.h. It is also available as a short ttstr type name.
　This type automatically manages memory for strings and has a high affinity with tTJSVariant type.

eTJS

　The eTJS type is the base type for C++ exception objects. Defined in tjsError.h. There is a method GetMessage that allows you to get the message string thrown with the exception.

TJS_W

　Macro to convert string literal to tjs_char * type.

Example: TJS_W ("string literal")
